reviews.text: Feel very let down by this hotel, on the first appearance it promises far more than it actualy delivers.
reviews.title: Run down hotel, fantastic location...

reviews.text: Reception is cramped, dated and gloomy and staff speak only broken English. Our room was of decent size on the ground floor but faced the street( v noisy) and was so gloomy with grubby carpet, marked and dirty lamps fixtures and fittings. The bathroom was dilapidated with water marks all over taps/shower screen and poorly applied waterproof putty around bath etc. The bed was so old and squeaky that this prompted us to ask for a room change! The next room was slightly better but so small with miniature bed(more like large single) far too small for 2 adults. The toilet was cracked, room was boiling hot even with window open...lamps were stained and not fitted, the coloured throw on bed was filthy as was the headboard and curtains didn't shut properly. This combined with v average breakfast did not a happy customer make. Do not stay here!
reviews.title: Great night's sleep. Helpful concierge. Clean room. Brilliant location

reviews.text: Generally helpful staff. Room small but clean and quiet with comfy beds. No hot water in morning but as long as you complained you were upgraded from continental to full English breakfast. 5 minutes walk from Oxford St. Crown and sceptre pub down road had beautiful Sunday dinner in lovely pub. Would stay here again
reviews.title: A good experience at fair price...small room though

reviews.text: I stayed one night. The room was small but comfortable. Very good location near tube and railway stations. Room service food was quick to arrive and decent. Breakfast choice good in the morning. Service was attentive and staff friendly and helpful. Criticisms? Small room and a bit tired. Poor choice of free TV channels, internet expensive. A bit airless on a warm night but no worse than other similar hotels.
reviews.title: Very pleased with last minute offer

reviews.text: I got a late deal for a room at this hotel, and was very happy with my stay. The room was very comfortable, of reasonable size for this style of hotel (a bit of a B&B feel about the place), bathroom was fine, tea and coffee in the room, and service was very professional. I didn't stay for breakfast as there are coffee shops quite near by. Only notable qualm was the very small, slow, old-fashioned lift. Overall, I'd be happy to stay there again.
reviews.title: Location is the ONLY positive thing

reviews.text: There's nothing glamorous about this hotel, but for a short stay (business rather than treating yourself) it absolutely fine. Not bad at all...
reviews.title: Just a step above basic, but more than acceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives: staff friendly and polite (contrary to past reviews the ones I encountered did speak English perfectly well), room clean and functional, quiet in evening (my room did not face the main street though), good location just a couple of minutes' walk from Oxford Circus tube
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Negatives: room was small (but fine), bathroom very small (bath tiny, toilet had to use sideways as my legs were too long to fit otherwise - I'm only 5'6"!), very limited room service menu, no vegetarian sausages on breakfast menu
reviews.title: Good Value in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, I'd be happy to stay here again if my work booked me in but if I was planning a personal trip to London and wanted to stay overnight somewhere I would only consider if it was a particularly competitive price. Functional with some good benefits, but nothing special.
reviews.title: great location fantastic breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all this is a review from an average working man who took his wife away for a birthday break and has just returned from a fantastic 3 day break to London,staying at the Grange Langham Court Hotel. I was abit nervous after reading some of the reviews but i can honestly say it is a great hotel in a great location,yes the rooms are abit ,but ours ( room 403 ) was lovely,with all the products,slippers,bathrobs etc,the towels n sheets seemed to be changed every day,it had an iron,trouser press and an hairdryer, honestly what more do you want ?. The lounge is lovely and yes the check in area is small but who cares !!. We had no problem being understood by any of the staff who in fact were very friendly n polite , It winds me up when i read some of the reviews complaining about silly petty things when there is really no cause for complaint,( rant over ) .The hotel is in a lovely area with two italian restaurants and pub nearby,can recommend them but stay clear of the Yorkshire Grey pub.Its only a 5min walk onto Oxford St and Regent St,you can walk to the theater area of London in about 15/20 mins infact we didnt use the tube or bus ,we walked everywhere n believe me we saw nearly everthing,nothing was to far out of reach from the hotel. If your thinking of going to London, n like me going through the multitude of hotels on tripadviser,then book at this hotel,you wont regret it
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location within walking distance of Oxford Street. Not very impressed with the staff though. They struggled to find our booking, struggled to answer our questions about parking. Just weren't very motivated or quick off the mark. The room was adequate, although very small. If you were a 20 stone 6ft 4 hulk of a man you would never manage though, and certainly not fit in the tiny shower cubicle! Room was clean and bed was comfortable, so served its purpose. Breakfast was fine, we had pastries and coffee and it was lovely.
reviews.title: great location, everything else just OK

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grange Langham Court Hotel for 2 nights on Friday 13th, on arrival the staff were very friendly and welcoming, we arrived about 12.30pm and was told the rooms would not be ready until 3.30pm but allowed us to leave our cases with them so we could go sightseeing and same on the day of departure. The hotel is in a great location just a couple of streets off Oxford Street which is ideal for shopping and is close to quite a few theatres (we went to see Wizard of OZ at the London Palladium Great Show would highly recommend). The rooms are very clean and have tea/coffee facilities, hairdryer, clean towels etc could not complain, breakfast is continental there was a choice of different cereals, toast, jams, tea/coffee, variety of juices, yoghurst, croissants, bread rolls, ham, salami and cheeses so had a variety to choose from, you would not definitely not starve!
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Opposite the Hotel there is a Samuel Smiths pub called The Yorkshire Grey (Beer very strong!) and two other pubs round the corner called Crown & Sceptre and the Kings arms, on the Friday all the pubs were very busy and found it difficult to get seated but Saturday was alot quieter - we had a really good night in the Kings arms, we had such a laugh with the Landlord and barman.
reviews.title: Compact

reviews.text: Overall if you are planning a trip to London I would highly recommend you to stay at the Langham Court - you cant beat the price (Very Good) for the location of this Hotel!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel with friendly staff

reviews.text: This plave has probably seen better days and is in need of a bit of a makeover. You neeed to be quite fit as there is only one very small lift which takes an age to come. Having said that the satff were very pleasant and the hotel well located for central London. The room ( single) was one of the smallest I had ever stayed in and I was not looking forward to trying to sleep there. As it happenned I also had one of my best nights sleep, under a fluffy duvet in a clean room, for a long time. Breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Basic but ok

reviews.text: Pricey version of a cheap hotel. No draught beers at all, really small rooms and staff with many linguistic skills - alas none of them English. AVOID! Best bits are the pub next door, off licence over the road and its in the middle of a vast selection of restaurantd so you dont have to put up with the lack of service displayed at breakfast, during the evening.
reviews.title: Go Somewhere else

reviews.text: I spent one night here on a business trip. The room was hot but spacious and clean, and the bed comfy. One problem only in the room was the sink plug which stuck!
reviews.title: Lovely clean comfy room but don't waste money on breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very unhappy with the breakfast which had been paid for at £17.50 and was just a continental breakfast . When I asked about having something cooked I was told loudly by a waitress that I would have to pay an extra £6.50. Much cheaper to have a good British breakfast offered in a restaurant locally.
reviews.title: 25th wedding anniversary

reviews.text: They advertise a complementary newspaper but I was given the Irish Times. Would have been great if I had been Irish!
reviews.title: Dissapointing at best

reviews.text: we had a lovely stay the room was nice clean, everything you would need was there. Dont know what some people expect. Nice friendly staff thanks too all who made our anniversary special
reviews.title: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone - defo not a 4-star!!
